metadata.title: CVE-2022-3032 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: When receiving an HTML email that contained an iframe element,which used a srcdoc attribute to define the inner HTMLdocument, remote objects specified in the nested document, for exampleimages or videos, were not blocked. Rather, the network was accessed, theobjects were loaded and displayed. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird <102.2.1 and Thunderbird < 91.13.1. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3032` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: thunderbird - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
